primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God preserves a remnant of humanity from His own righteous judgment to initiate a plan of salvation that culminates in Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: He has already set a plan of salvation in motion
God performs an unambiguous act of divine grace

object.identificatie: The preservation and redemption of the human race/creation
tekstueel_bewijs: preserving Noah and the earth’s creatures
the first step in God’s mighty plan to redeem the earth
God’s own righteous wrath at sin

ontvanger.identificatie: Noah, his descendants, and 'every living creature'
tekstueel_bewijs: a sign of the covenant between me and the earth
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one saved through water).

helper.identificatie: The Ark / The Covenant / Jesus Christ
tekstueel_bewijs: the wonder of the ark and its cargo
the rainbow bridge leads to the Cross
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (Providence/Ark) transitioning to sacramental power (Baptism).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin and the resulting Divine Wrath/Judgment
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is not a mistake but a 'sinkhole' that 'ruined everything' and necessitates a global 'wiping out'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of worship and perspective-shift following salvation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Noah / The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Noah's silence during the flood emphasizes passivity; his action (altar) only occurs after the primary program is completed by God.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God had no reason to put up with humanity.
God has already set a plan of salvation in motion.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Noah does not utter a single word.
We here in Salisbury are not excused.

voorbeelden: we should become like the Biblical writers
Christians are not supposed to be satisfied
The question for faith is whether this is or is not the right description
learned to see sin as God sees it
persuade people to read the story on an adult level
God's promise not to destroy us
any righteousness... is derived from God’s favor rather than any capacity of our own

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'Power to Save' over the human 'Obligation to Do'. Human incompetence is assumed; divine competence is the focus.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S2 (denial of sin/individualism) to S2 (the reality of the flood/wrath), then to S1 (the Ark/Covenant) through the mediation of Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension between His wrath (S2) and His love (S1) by providing the Ark/Christ, allowing S1 to prevail despite the persistence of ~S1 (human evil).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The preacher insists on God's right to 'wipe out the human race'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor; Noah is a passive recipient. The focus is on God's initiative and the unconditionality of the covenant.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Christians are not supposed to be satisfied with the world as it is.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Noah does not utter a single word during the whole story.
God performs an unambiguous act of divine grace. He reveals that his covenant... is unconditional.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Noah is explicitly rejected as a moral hero or example of innate righteousness.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Noah is God's agent and a recipient of favor, not a model of behavior.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and conviction; shifting from self-justification to reliance on the 'rainbow bridge' of the Cross.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon perfectly integrates the OT narrative with NT Christology via the theme of 'Plan of Salvation'.
spanning_punten: The paradox that God promises never to flood again even though 'man's heart is evil from his youth'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: preserving Noah... from God’s own righteous wrath at sin.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Father's decree and the Son's work than the Spirit's internal work.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total depravity ('every imagination... only evil continually').

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven entirely by God's will. Humans are actants of 'Lack' and 'Reception'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic Lenten 'Grace' structure.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Could slightly increase 'Vouloir' (the hearer's desire for the covenant).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God saves) → Ethics (Noah builds altar/We see sin differently).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids the trap of making Noah a 'hero of faith' to be imitated, focusing instead on the God who shuts the door.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'ant/elephant' metaphor; semiotics reveals that this metaphor serves to displace the human Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Gilgamesh parallels; semiotics explains how those parallels highlight the unique 'Sender' role of the Biblical God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that Noah's 'silence' is not just a literary detail but a structural necessity to maintain God as the sole Subject of the primary program.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (decrees, sets in motion, picks out, shuts, smells, reveals, makes)
volledige_object_lijst: The human race (to be blotted out/saved)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' effectively by making God the subject of almost all transformative verbs.
